Module ActiveRecord::Acts::Category::ClassMethods
In: lib/active_record/acts/category.rb

ClassMethods module #

Methods

acts_as_category   hidden   hidden=   hidden_sql  

Public Class methods

hidden()

Returns an array with ids of all categories, which are to be hidden. Returns an empty array if none. The idea is, to prevent users without given rights to see hidden categories. This is done by defining a class variable hidden each time the user logs in (which is job of the controller, in case you would like to use this functionality).

[Source]

    # File lib/active_record/acts/category.rb, line 88
88:           def self.hidden
89:             class_variable_get :@@hidden
90:           end
hidden=(ids)

Takes an array of ids of categories and defines these to be hidden. Note that it overwrites the array with each call, instead of adding further ids to it.

[Source]

     # File lib/active_record/acts/category.rb, line 101
101:           def self.hidden=(ids)
102:             hidden = []
103:             ids.each { |id| hidden << id.to_i if id.to_i > 0 } if ids.is_a?(Array)
104:             class_variable_set :@@hidden, hidden.uniq
105:           end
hidden_sql(with_and = false)

Creates a WHERE clause for SQL statements, which causes hidden categories not to be included. Adds AND if parameter true is given. 

 hidden_sql       #=> " id NOT IN (3,6,12) "
 hidden_sql(true) #=> " AND id NOT IN (3,6,12) "

[Source]

    # File lib/active_record/acts/category.rb, line 96
96:           def self.hidden_sql(with_and = false)
97:             hidden.size == 0 ? '' : "#{with_and ? ' AND' : ''} id NOT IN (#{hidden.join(',')}) "
98:           end

Public Instance methods

acts_as_category(options = {})

Needs columns: ancestors_count, descendants_count, children_count

Please note that parent_id will not be validated on "update" and "update_attribute", so don‘t use either

Methods which will respect the hidden functionality: 

 Category.get(id)       as a replacement for find(id)
          root
          roots

     self.children
          children.size
          children.empty?
          children_ids
          descendants
          descendants_ids
          siblings
          self_and_siblings
Q:Why is find not respecting hidden?
A:I didn‘t feel comfortable overwriting the find method for Categories and it is not really needed.
Q:Why are ancestors, ancestors_ids and self.parent not respecting hidden?
A:Because the whole idea of hidden is to exclude descendants of an hidden Category as well, thus the ancestors will never be hidden.

Configuration options are:

  • foreign_key - specifies the column name to use for tracking of the tree (default: parent_id)
  • position - specifies the integer column name to use for ordering categories (default: position)
  • order - specifies a column name to use for ordering children and root(s) (default: position)

[Source]

 52:         def acts_as_category(options = {})
 53:     
 54:           # Load parameters whenever acts_as_category is called
 55:           configuration = { :foreign_key => "parent_id", :position => "position", :order => "position", :children_count => 'children_count', :ancestors_count => 'ancestors_count', :descendants_count => 'descendants_count' }
 56:           configuration.update(options) if options.is_a?(Hash)
 57:           
 58:           # Create a class association to itself
 59:           belongs_to :parent, :class_name => name, :foreign_key => configuration[:foreign_key], :counter_cache => configuration[:children_count]
 60:           has_many :children, :class_name => name, :foreign_key => configuration[:foreign_key], :order => configuration[:order], :dependent => :destroy
 61: 
 62:           # Substantial validations
 63:           before_validation :validate_foreign_key
 64:           before_validation_on_create :assign_position
 65:           validates_numericality_of configuration[:foreign_key], :only_integer => true, :greater_than => 0, :allow_nil => true, :message => 'Category must exist, and cannot be its own descendant'
 66:           validates_numericality_of configuration[:position],    :only_integer => true, :greater_than => 0
 67: 
 68:           # Callbacks for automatic refresh of ancestors_count & descendants_count cache columns
 69:           after_create :refresh_cache_after_create
 70:           before_update :prepare_refresh_before_update
 71:           after_update :refresh_cache_after_update
 72:           before_destroy :prepare_refresh_before_destroy
 73:           after_destroy :refresh_cache_after_destroy
 74: 
 75:           # Add readonly attribute to cache columns
 76:           attr_readonly configuration[:ancestors_count] if column_names.include? configuration[:ancestors_count]
 77:           attr_readonly configuration[:descendants_count] if column_names.include? configuration[:descendants_count]

 87:           # The idea is, to prevent users without given rights to see hidden categories. This is done by defining a class variable +hidden+ each time the user logs in (which is job of the controller, in case you would like to use this functionality).
 88:           def self.hidden
 89:             class_variable_get :@@hidden
 90:           end
 91:           
 92:           # Creates a WHERE clause for SQL statements, which causes hidden categories not to be included. Adds AND if parameter +true+ is given.
 93:           #
 94:           #  hidden_sql       #=> " id NOT IN (3,6,12) "
 95:           #  hidden_sql(true) #=> " AND id NOT IN (3,6,12) "
 96:           def self.hidden_sql(with_and = false)
 97:             hidden.size == 0 ? '' : "#{with_and ? ' AND' : ''} id NOT IN (#{hidden.join(',')}) "
 98:           end
 99:           
100:           # Takes an +array+ of +ids+ of categories and defines these to be hidden. Note that it overwrites the array with each call, instead of adding further ids to it.
101:           def self.hidden=(ids)
102:             hidden = []
103:             ids.each { |id| hidden << id.to_i if id.to_i > 0 } if ids.is_a?(Array)
104:             class_variable_set :@@hidden, hidden.uniq
105:           end
106:           
107:           # This class_eval contains methods which cannot be added wihtout having a concrete model.
108:           # Say, we want these methods to use parameters like "configuration[:foreign_key]", but we
109:           # don't have these parameters, unless somebody evokes the acts_as_category method in his
110:           # model. So we use class_eval, which generates methods, when acts_as_category is called,
111:           # and not already when our plugin's init.rb adds our Acts::Category modules to ActiveRecord.
112:           # Another example is, that we want to overwrite the association method "children", but this
113:           # association doesn't exist before acts_as_category is actually called. So we need class_eval.
114: 
115:           class_eval "\n##############################\n# Generated instance methods #\n##############################\n\n# Include instance methods from our InstanceMethods module\ninclude ActiveRecord::Acts::Category::InstanceMethods\n\n# Define instance getter and setter methods to keep track of the column name options\ndef parent_id_column() '\#{configuration[:foreign_key]}' end\ndef parent_id_column=(id) write_attribute('\#{configuration[:foreign_key]}', id) end\ndef position_column() '\#{configuration[:position]}' end\ndef position_column=(pos) write_attribute('\#{configuration[:position]}', pos) end\ndef children_count_column() '\#{configuration[:children_count]}' end\ndef ancestors_count_column() '\#{configuration[:ancestors_count]}' end\ndef descendants_count_column() '\#{configuration[:descendants_count]}' end\n\n# Overwrite the children association method, so it will respect hidden categories\nalias :orig_children :children\ndef children\nresult = orig_children\nresult.delete_if { |child| child.hidden? }\nresult\nend\n\n###########################\n# Generated class methods #\n###########################\n\n# Update cache columns of a whole branch, which includes the given +category+ or its +id+.\ndef self.refresh_cache_of_branch_with(category)\ncategory = find(category) unless category.instance_of?(self)   # possibly convert id into category\nroot = category.\#{configuration[:foreign_key]}.nil? ? category : category.root   # find root of category (if not already)\nroot.refresh_cache\nroot.descendants.each { |d| d.refresh_cache }\nend\n\n# Returns the +category+ to a given +id+. This is as a replacement for find(id), but it respects hidden categories.\ndef self.get(id)\nfind(:first, :conditions => 'id = ' + id.to_i.to_s + hidden_sql(true), :order => \#{configuration[:order].nil? ? 'nil' : %Q{\"\#{configuration[:order]}\"}})\nend\n\n# Returns all root +categories+\ndef self.roots\nfind(:all, :conditions => '\#{configuration[:foreign_key]} IS NULL' + hidden_sql(true), :order => \#{configuration[:order].nil? ? 'nil' : %Q{\"\#{configuration[:order]}\"}})\nend\n\n# Receives the controller's +params+ variable and updates category positions accordingly. Please refer to the helper methods that came with this model for further information.\ndef self.update_positions(params)\nparams.each_key { |key|\nif key.include?('sortable_categories_')\nparent_id = key.split('_').last.to_i\nparams[key].each_with_index { |id, position|\ncategory = find(id)\n# Verify that every category is valid and from the correct parent\nraise ArgumentError, 'Invalid attempt to update a category position: Cannot update a category (ID '+category.id.to_s+') out of given parent_id (ID '+parent_id.to_s+')' unless category.\#{configuration[:foreign_key]}.nil? && parent_id == 0 || parent_id > 0 && category.\#{configuration[:foreign_key]} == parent_id\n@counter = position + 1\n}\nself_and_siblings_count = parent_id <= 0 ? roots.size : find(parent_id).children.count\n# Verify that the parameters correspond to every child of this parent\nraise ArgumentError, 'Invalid attempt to update a category position: Number of category IDs in param hash is wrong ('+@counter.to_s+' instead of '+self_and_siblings_count.to_s+' for parent with ID '+parent_id.to_s+')' unless @counter == self_and_siblings_count\n# Do the actual position update\nparams[key].each_with_index { |id, position| find(id).update_attribute('\#{configuration[:position]}', position + 1)}\nend\n}\nrescue ActiveRecord::RecordNotFound\nraise ArgumentError, 'Invalid attempt to update a category position: Parent category does not exist'\nend\n\n"
116:         end
